# DEPARTMENT OF STATE TELEGRAM
**UNCLASSIFIED**

::: {.cable-meta}
:::


1. Gonzalo Gutierrez, director of metallurgy in Ministry of Mining and Metallurgy, called on Emboff and asked embassy help to obtain 6 to 9 month technical assistance to ministry in connection with World Bank loan of US$ 6,200,000 of which US$ 350,000 is destined to set up following sections in ministry: (1) Sectorial planning regarding mining industry development; (2) Documentation center carrying all information on mines; (3) Taxation system involving search for best mining taxation method to be used in Bolivia; and (4) Prefeasibility study on mineral exploration.

2. Salaries to be paid technicians are approximately US$ 3,500 per person per month. U.S. government employees on loan for this project preferred due to temporary nature of employment. Technicians sought should be experts on: (1) Mine planning, (2) Preparation and evaluation of mines, (3) Administration, (4) Statistician, (5) Ore commercialization, (6) Financial analyst, and (7) Documentation specialist.

3. World Bank destined US$ 850,000 of loan to be used by Servicio Geologico de Bolivia (GEOBOL) to take inventory of all mines in country and classify them on basis of production potential.

4. Loan also includes US$ 5,000,000 to be used for medium miners through Banco Industrial to develop mines and for purchase of equipment.

5. Ministry of Mining now working on exact plans of reference for these positions mentioned in Item 2. These will be pouched when available. Plans are for technicians to start work on July 1, 1974.

6. **Required Action:** Please inform government agencies and industry of these temporary positions.
